description.narrative: DCPSF är en givarfond som hanteras av UNDP. Fondens strategi är att stödja projekt på gräsrotsnivå som arbetar med de grundläggande orsakerna till konflikterna på lokal nivå i Darfur. Detta gjordes tidigare med syftet att komplettera övergripande fredsprocesser, men detta syfte har i praktiken ersatts med det förväntade resultatet: "Stärkt förmåga att genom lokala fredsinitiativ förebygga konflikter och åstadkomma försoning i Darfur". Projekten under DCPSF pågår parallellt med pågående humanitära insatser, där samverkan främst sker genom koordering och utbyte av information om läget i Darfur. DCPSF utgör ett av de få program som stödjer fredsbyggande på lokal nivå i Darfur.

Darfur Community and Peace Building Fund (DCPSF), phase 2 (2011-2020). A community driven peace and reconciliation initiative. UNDP administers the fund which aims to foster dialogue and funding of small scale peace building initiatives at community level. The support is a second tranche for phase 2, in line with the Results Strategy for Sudan, 2014-2017.

Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: During the reporting period, the DCPSF has managed to achieve the following results: (i) The launching of the new Call for Proposal (CfP). The CfP had been delayed due to changes in DCPSF TS Staff and COVID-19. The process was informed by the recommendations of the DCPSF 2017 evaluation, the revised Terms of Reference, as well as the 2019 Conflict Analysis report. The process closed with the selection of 17 organisations that will implement 17 projects in all the five states of Darfur. Implementation started in February 2021. (ii) The implementation of five Covid-19 emergency projects, one in each Darfur state. The DCPSF intervention focused on: Awareness-building among the local communities in Darfur; Strengthening of COVID-19 surveillance through supporting local health centres; Promotion of good hygiene and sanitation among communities through the provision of handwashing equipment, masks, and COVID-19 awareness posters with prevention messages; and Partnership strengthening with state governments and other relevant organisations. (iii) Completion of the four remaining projects during the previous CfP. The projects had been delayed, partly as a consequence of the 2019 revolution. (iv) Phase I of the The Gender and Peacebuilding Initiative (GAPI) was finalized, and the initiative entered Phase II, with the research component under Phase I informing a project designed to address challenges, as well as capitalize on possible opportunities as identified for Phase II.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
